title: SmallSpark Completes Hot Fire Test of Thruster Prototype
summary:
Welsh space tech startup SmallSpark Space Systems has completed a long-duration hot fire test of a prototype of its NEWT-A2 thruster. In December 2022, SmallSpark received a £76,000 grant from the UK Space Agency to assist with the development of its NEWT-A2 thruster. The company describes it as “the world’s simplest bi-propellant satellite thruster.” The […]
The post SmallSpark Completes Hot Fire Test of Thruster Prototype appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: FAA Proposes Upper Stage Disposal Rule To Limit Space Debris
summary: The FAA is proposing a new rule requiring commercial space companies to dispose of their rocket upper stages to limit the creation of more space debris. Five disposal methods are […]

title: Maxar Technologies reorganizes as two separate businesses
summary: Maxar Technologies is reorganizing and has eliminated executive positions, the company confirmed Sept. 20

title: Artemis II Crew Conduct Launch Day Demo At KSC
summary: NASA and the Artemis II Crew have conducted a launch day demo at NASA Kennedy Space Center in Florida, as preparations for launch start to ramp up with the beginning of Artemis II ground system testing.

title: NASA Set To Begin Artemis II Ground System Testing
summary: As NASA prepares to launch people back to the moon for the first time in 50 years, engineers are preparing for a series of ground demonstration tests at NASA's Kennedy Space Center for the Artemis II mission.

title: SpaceX breaks another booster reuse record, but did anyone see it?
summary: SpaceX has continued its trend toward a minimalist broadcast approach.

title: FCC directing more satellite constellations to mitigate effects on astronomy
summary: The FCC is requiring more operators of satellite constellations to work with astronomers to minimize the effects their satellites will have on ground-based astronomy.

title: The Startup Nation in Space – Israel’s Equation for the Space Ecosystem
summary: From pioneering lunar missions with private spacecraft to achieving domestic satellite capabilities, Israel has defied its size and resources to make a significant impact in Earth's space history.

title: SpaceX countersues Justice Department, seeking to dismiss hiring discrimination case
summary: Elon Musk’s SpaceX sued the U.S. Department of Justice in a Texas federal court, as the company aims to stop the DOJ’s hiring discrimination case on constitutional grounds.

title: RFA-Led Consortium Submit Argo for ESA Commercial Cargo Initiative
summary:
A consortium led by German launch startup Rocket Factory Augsburg has unveiled its Argo space station resupply vehicle. The consortium has submitted the vehicle for consideration to the European Space Agency’s Commercial Cargo Transportation Initiative (CCTI). ESA launched CCTI in May with the aim of encouraging European industry to develop a space cargo transportation system […]
